ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An interesting window into the Baroque period, but possibly a little unfocused. I would recommend it in general.
I would recommend this class for another student as a good introduction to the colonial Baroque.

I would certainly recommend SPAN 765 to another student. Readings are very challenging, and class meetings and Professor Adorno's assignments and questions will get you to think critically about the material.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course enabled me to better understand the colonial Baroque from a transatlantic perspective and to consider the relationship between literature and politics in the colonial context.

A solid foundation of Colonial Latin American literature is fundamental to my dissertation research and future career as a Hispanist. For this reason SPAN 765 was exceedingly helpful for me. In addition, Professor Adorno's approach to studying literature helped me to understand the level of seriousness required to be a successful researcher in this field.
